page.title: 05TOURISTS IN FYLINGDALES
page.content: Tourists come to Robin Hoods Bay from big towns to get away from it all. Maybe the name intrigues them and they think it has something to do with Robin Hood the outlaw. Many tales are told and explanations given but nobody knows for sure how the village got its name. People come from all over the country. We have visitors from Middlesbrough, Glasgow, Peebles and Darlington in the north, from Chesterfield, Canterbury, London and York in the south, from Liverpool and Leeds in the west and from many other towns and villages all over the British Isles. We also have visitors from abroad, both from Europe and America. We did a survey one weekend when we asked the visitors seven questions. 98% said they would come again. We were pleased that they liked it here.
